definitions.definition: The nearness of objects with little or no delimiter .

subdefinitions.definition: An absence of linking elements in a group of words that are listed together.
An absence of operators in an expression.
examples: Using juxtaposition for multiplication saves space when writing longer expressions. a × b {\displaystyle a\times b} collapses to a b {\displaystyle ab} .

definitions.definition: The extra emphasis given to a comparison when the contrasted objects are close together.
examples: There was a poignant juxtaposition between the boys laughing in the street and the girl crying on the balcony above.

subdefinitions.definition: Two or more contrasting sounds , colours , styles etc. placed together for stylistic effect.
examples: The juxtaposition of the bright yellows on the dark background made the painting appear three dimensional.

subdefinitions.definition: The close placement of two ideas to imply a link that may not exist.

main_definition: The nearness of objects with little or no delimiter .
secondary_definitions: The extra emphasis given to a comparison when the contrasted objects are close together.
